page.title: 07LIFESTYLE-TINTINHULL
page.content: Since 1904 Tintinhull has greatly changed.It is now 4 times larger and not so pretty.It used to have many apple orchards from which cider was made. The men worked on the farms and the glove factories and home machines catered for the women. As transport was difficult and there were not many sources of news,people were apt to pry. Mrs Noon remembers the first car she saw.It was a Ford and the driver gave her a lift.By 1926 there were 3 cars in Tintinhull. The great day of the year was Tintinhull Club Day,when the villagers visited the farms,had a meal in the Parish Hall and then a dance was held. It was organised by the Blue Marine Club.Mrs Noon's father was secretary.
